alert.note: Alert for Adair; Adams; Cass; Clarke; Decatur; Lucas; Madison; Ringgold; Taylor; Union; Warren; Wayne (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 9:24PM CST until January 13 at 6:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Blizzard Conditions Continue into Saturday... ...Life Threatening Wind Chills Expected Saturday into Early Next Week... .A multi-faceted dangerous winter storm will continue to affect Iowa into Saturday. This dangerous storm will continue to bring additional light snow across much of the state tonight and tomorrow with additional accumulations generally an inch or less through Saturday. Winds will continue to increase, with life threatening blizzard conditions at least into Saturday central and north. Dangerous temperatures follow into the weekend through early next week, with wind chill values down to 45 below zero expected. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Total snow accumulations of up to an inch or two north. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero at times. For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow and reduced visibilities under a mile possible. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Southwest into south central Iowa. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 6 AM CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from midnight tonight to noon CST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 AM to 6 PM CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Iowa Department of Transportation reports travel not advised across much of central Iowa this evening, with some roads impassable due to blowing and drifting snow. Towing is not recommended over the much of the area so you may be stranded if an accident occurs.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
